meanings.definition: The state or condition of being hypotonic.
meanings.sent1: The hypotonicities of the solution caused the cell to swell.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the hypotonicities of the patient's cells.
meanings.sent3: The hypotonicities of the drink made the fruit inside plump and juicy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with a hypotonicities that lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The hypotonicities of the lake water made it perfect for swimming.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of having lower osmotic pressure than a reference solution.
meanings.sent1: Scientists measured the hypotonicities of the liquid to determine its properties.
meanings.sent2: The hypotonicities of the solution affected the cell's behavior.
meanings.sent3: The hypotonicities of the balloon made it easier to blow up.
meanings.sent4: The hypotonicities of the situation created a sense of calm.
meanings.sent5: The hypotonicities of the air in the room made it feel refreshing.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a solution to cause a cell to swell due to a lower concentration of solutes outside the cell.
meanings.sent1: The hypotonicities of the liquid made the cell expand.
meanings.sent2: The hypotonicities of the environment affected the cell's size.
meanings.sent3: The hypotonicities of the situation made the cell feel bloated.
meanings.sent4: The hypotonicities of the solution stretched the cell membrane.
meanings.sent5: The hypotonicities of the water caused the cell to absorb more fluid.
